PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Thrombocytosis And/Or Polycythemia Disease or Disorder

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Thrombocytosis And/Or Polycythemia Disease or Disorder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Increased numbers of platelets in the peripheral blood. (Dorland, 27th ed): Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: Abnormally high mass or concentration of red blood cells in the blood, either due to an increase in erythropoiesis or a decrease in plasma volume.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A hematology test result that indicates the presence of higher than normal platelet counts in the peripheral blood.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Abnormally high mass or concentration of red blood cells in the blood, either due to an increase in erythropoiesis or a decrease in plasma volume.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Abnormal enlargement of the spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pathological hardening or thickening of tissue, especially that of the interstitial substance.: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of bone.

Concepts.definition: A pathological hardening or thickening of tissue, especially that of the interstitial substance.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of bone.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease or disorder affecting more than one nerve.

Concepts.definition: A disease or disorder affecting more than one nerve.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Swelling around the optic disc, usually due to increased intracranial pressure or pressure on the optic nerve by a tumor.

Concepts.definition: Swelling around the optic disc, usually due to increased intracranial pressure or pressure on the optic nerve by a tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An enlarged lymph node. Causes include viral and bacterial infections and cancers that affect the lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: An enlarged lymph node. Causes include viral and bacterial infections and cancers that affect the lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by lymphoid hyperplasia in the lymph nodes. There are two histologic variants recognized: the hyaline-vascular type and the plasma cell type. In the hyaline vascular type there are hyalinized vessels present in the lymphoid follicles. In the plasma cell type there is pronounced plasma cell proliferation. Clinically, the disease may be localized; manifested with localized lymphadenopathy, or multicentric; manifested with generalized lymphadenopathy, fever, organomegaly, and sometimes POEMS syndrome. In contrast to patients with localized disease who are usually cured following resection of the lesion, patients with the multicentric form of the disease may follow a progressive clinical course, complicated by infection, Kaposi sarcoma or lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by lymphoid hyperplasia in the lymph nodes. There are two histologic variants recognized: the hyaline-vascular type and the plasma cell type. In the hyaline vascular type there are hyalinized vessels present in the lymphoid follicles. In the plasma cell type there is pronounced plasma cell proliferation. Clinically, the disease may be localized; manifested with localized lymphadenopathy, or multicentric; manifested with generalized lymphadenopathy, fever, organomegaly, and sometimes POEMS syndrome. In contrast to patients with localized disease who are usually cured following resection of the lesion, patients with the multicentric form of the disease may follow a progressive clinical course, complicated by infection, Kaposi sarcoma or lymphoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fluid volume expansion that occurs outside of the vascular system, which may be characterized by peripheral edema, pleural effusion, ascites, and pericardial effusion.

Concepts.definition: Fluid volume expansion that occurs outside of the vascular system, which may be characterized by peripheral edema, pleural effusion, ascites, and pericardial effusion.
